author: potuz

author: .funnyking
content: hallo i did that tests on Erigon and Akula, this september I ran a Go Ethereum instance with -syncmode=full, almost the same as Erigon pruned mode on a 16GB machine with NVME memory.

author: .funnyking
content: geth took 7days and circa 18hours to reach the tip of the chain

author: .funnyking
content: erigon 2 days and circa 13h to do the same with less footprint (600gb)

author: .funnyking
content: I didn't even try to synchronize geth in full archivial node because I don't have 7 terabytes (maybe I need more) of disk space and it would have taken a month anyway.

author: .funnyking
content: To give an idea, currently Erigon on a machine with 16Gb of Ram synchronizes in full archivial node (that is the deafult mode of Erigon) between 79 and 80 hours 3 days and 8 hours, and consumes 1.55Tb of disk space for chain data.

author: .funnyking
content: In "Snap sync" mode, i.e. without transaction validation by execution but with download of states, geth is obviously extremely fast. For now Erigon does not yet have its own synchronization system for downloading states, i.e. without validating them by execution.

author: .funnyking
content: When we get it I will do more comparative testing.
